name: Tetsuya's Oysters with Japanese Dressing
description: This recipe is based on Tetsuayâ€™s oyster dressing from his cookbook. I changed the proportions and added sesame and mirin to make the dressing more flavourful and re-align the balance of salt/sweet/tang. I think he uses premium sauces which can cost 5x as much as mainstream brands!If salmon roe is out of reach, just skip it. This dressing is so good on its own. Use liberally and save leftovers for salad or dipping prawns!Makes enough for 24 oysters.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 tsp Japanese soy sauce ((substitute light soy, Note 1))
3 tbsp grapeseed or vegetable oil ((or other neutral oil))
20 g / 2/3 oz (1 heaped tbsp)  salmon roe (, for topping (optional, makes it extra special, Note 6))
Rock salt (, crushed ice or leafy greens - for serving bed (Note 7))

itemListElement.text: Combine sugar, soy, rice vinegar and mirin in a jug or bowl. Whisk well until sugar is dissolved. Add oils and ginger. Whisk again and use immediately.
itemListElement.name: Combine sugar, soy, rice vinegar and mirin in a jug or bowl. Whisk well until sugar is dissolved. Add oils and ginger. Whisk again and use immediately.

itemListElement.text: Place oysters on a serving platter on ice or rock salt (Note 7).
itemListElement.name: Place oysters on a serving platter on ice or rock salt (Note 7).

itemListElement.text: Spoon dressing in each - I use 3/4 teaspoon on small oysters and 1 1/4 teaspoon for large. Or more!
itemListElement.name: Spoon dressing in each - I use 3/4 teaspoon on small oysters and 1 1/4 teaspoon for large. Or more!

itemListElement.text: Top with a small pile of salmon roe, sprinkle with chives. Serve!
